text: Does anyone have recommendations for newer laptops for all-around use?

elements.text: Does anyone have recommendations for newer laptops for all-around use?

text: I just got Dell Evo from Costco last weekend. 13th Gen Intel Core i7-1360P, 16GB memory, 1TB SSD. It was on sale for $200 off. I don't play video games and am not a fan of glossy screens so it fits my needs. The fan is louder than usual I think. I personally don't really mind much. Hope it helps.

elements.text: I just got Dell Evo from Costco last weekend. 13th Gen Intel Core i7-1360P, 16GB memory, 1TB SSD. It was on sale for $200 off. I don't play video games and am not a fan of glossy screens so it fits my needs. The fan is louder than usual I think. I personally don't really mind much. Hope it helps.

text:
I just bought 2x <https://www.bestbuy.com/site/asus-tuf-gaming-a16-16-165hz-gaming-laptop-fhd-amd-ryzen-7-7735hs-with-16gb-ddr5-memory-radeon-rx7600s-512gb-pcie-ssd-off-black/6535499.p?skuId=6535499&utm_source=feed&ref=212&loc=1&gad_source=1&gclid=CjwKCAiAx_GqBhBQEiwAlDNAZkQk3GviCS1lR7HCtiTh9_WWvnhWl0j0rqoCYeABF3xiA7T7feRgExoCdMkQAvD_BwE&gclsrc=aw.ds|asus a16s>, with the idea that they can be used for business and pleasure, they are decently over the recommended settings for bg3 graphics.

On laptops, I am a big fan of outputting to a 4k monitor, and having a decent keyboard/mouse plugged in as well. These fit what I need, and at $750, not a bad price while they are $350 off.

I have seen plenty of used gaming laptops on facebook marketplace. Plenty of bargains to snag. Almost anything marketed as "gaming" when it was released throws in a decent processor, and at least a modest graphics card(for handling outputting to a 4k).

I compare video cards these days against a 2060, which will run most things on the gaming side as well.
